text: Came here for restaurant week and was so disappointed. Got sat an hour after our reservation and the only reason I am giving it 2 stars is because they did a phenomenal job with trying to make sure we were taken care of. That being said the food was meh.....I have heard the same from a lot of ppl and told myself I would give it a try. The atmosphere is nice but I don't think it's worth the money food wise.

Everything from the atmosphere to servers to appetizers to dinners were absolutely fantastic! It caters to every age group and lifestyle! Reasonable noise level and with 10 year old twins, very "kid friendly" for a trendy adult atmosphere. Highly recommend!!!

Our waitress was lovely, but the wait time was outrageously long. The restaurant had emptied out before our dinner arrived--I think we waited over an hour. The food was not that good... My chicken taco was so dried out that the meat was crunchy and flavorless. This is not our first time waiting forever and then getting so-so food, so I'm finally leaving a review.

Pretty active bar scene on a Wednesday night, the place was packed as was the dining area. 
Ordered the meat loaf...yuck! And this is supposed to be one of their signature dishes. The meatloaf was dry. It was sitting on a bed of very dry mashed potatoes that almost seemed like they were instant and they didn't add enough water. With it were some peas that we're shriveled up.  
At least the drinks were good. And that is the only reason I would go back here.

I hate giving this place a low rating because the food was good and our service was excellent, but my boyfriend and I had a horrible dining experience due to the following:
We decided to try this restaurant on a Sunday. It was crowded, and still early, so there were families nearby. Despite this, a gentleman and what appeared to be a stripper were all over each other next to our table. This was our date night, so watching a girl sit on a guy's lap and make out with the guy next to me was disturbing. I later found out that this guy was an owner, a friend informed me that his name is Mills. 
Not only this but we were seated at one of the banquettes against the wall, where I had to slide into the table to be seated. The purses/bags/random clothing items from the party next to us were spilling into the section where I was sitting, and they did not bother to move them so I could sit. Once again, the party next to us was that of someone who owns part of this restaurant. 

If I wanted to have a date at a strip club, I would do exactly that. I'm all for watching a lap dance, but not on date night where I'm dropping $100+ on a meal, and not in front of families and children. I highly recommend rethinking this business strategy, or at least practicing mild class.

After having read so many positive comments and reviews, I was really disappointed after my experience here. The food was underwhelming and the staff was not very accommodating. Sadly, I don't believe that I'll be returning anytime soon

The Mushroom Crepe was excellent and an incredible hearty vegetarian dish. Wish there were more places in Charlotte offering such a variety of options of just veggies but this spot is always dependable.

It's my second time at Nan and Byron's and I'm still not impressed. You can imagine my shock when my friends were charged for Parmesan cheese and mayo.  When my friend asked for fresh cracked pepper  on the somewhat bland shrimp pasta the waiter pointed to the pepper on the table.  The waiter told us that the kitchen won't give them a condiment without a ticket so they are forced to charge for it.  

The service was mediocre both times. 

The menu also needs some work.  Everything is fried, has cheese involved or seems unhealthy (a beet burger-but it's fried).  Don't get me wrong, I love fried and I love cheese but there should be a couple healthy options.

Nothing special. I had the crispy beet burger which they forgot to put the cheese on. Ugh. Also, the mashed potatoes were pretty bland. Its a cool little spot with nice interiors, maybe good for drinks - but you're better off going somewhere else in South End when it comes to the food.

This was my third time here. We went for lunch at an off time so it was very quiet in the restaurant. 

They provide a basket of some spicy popcorn while you wait for your food. Yum. Make sure you have some water on hand  if spice gets you. 

This particular visit I went for the salmon soft tacos. They came with more than enough lettuce, tomato, the most delicious guacamole and cheese for days. The flavor on the salmon was perfect and I was more than full as you get three tacos. 

My friend got the turkey club and loved it. 
She also got some salted caramel dessert, which I snuck a bite, and it was ohmygod good. 

I love this place. I love the country chic decor. It's casual and comfy. 

The only issue I had was.. It was dead and our server wasn't the most attentive. She was just standing around talking while we waited for water refills. I'm not one who needs much - but I could see this being an issue if it were busier.  

Overall- I would most definitely go back!

Went here last night with my girl for dinner. The food was great! we got several dishes and split them so that we could try a bunch of different stuff. Our favorites were the poppers and the meatloaf, but everything was delicious. This is a great local spot with a very unique vibe and design. We will definitely be coming back many times.

I took my boyfriend (who lives out of town) here because I love the atmosphere and I have always been told how great the food was. The service was fine, our waitress was nice and attentive for the most part however the food is what lacked. I ordered the prime bistro steak, it came with mashed potatoes. While the food was just okay, it came out cold and my steak was slightly overdone. I am not a fan of cold mashed potatoes.The drinks were good but I felt very small for the price. I wish I could give this 2 and a half stars because it is a fun place but way too over priced for what you get. 

Favorite thing here is the popcorn! It's a nice touch and delicious so make sure you get it! The oysters are also a great app!

We are repeated take out diners.  We live close by. Used to love this place but after repeated errors on our meals just find it hard to go back.  Below is a list of issues:

Consistently don't provide the right temperature of burger. They always under cook.  No exaggeration. I am not sure they understand the difference between rare and anything else.

They overcook fries.

Have forgotten to add meat to the tacos!!! Like zero meat.  I have gotten a shell with veggies!

Added cheese to burgers that was not requested.

Forget to add our soft drinks to the order.

The food itself is fine. The service delivery is lacking.  I can't be the only one with these mistakes.

While we catch most of them before we leave, it's not my job. They need a head chef that monitors quality because it is not there. Too many mistakes.

went there for first time earlier in the week for lunch and it was great- enjoyed it so much that I made resv. for my kids and hubby for Sunday Brunch- it was Extremely disappointing- a waste of money-
 flies were landing on food- a lot of it was undercooked and   getting servers to wait on us at the start took 10 min. to get a glass of water and a greeting from someone-
 it was not even busy then. was not worth the 24 bucks per person.
  Nan and Byrons  can do good food, but Sunday brunch is not  when  they. are doing  it..... don't try to do clever "riffs" on classic dishes- just please do them well and pay attention to them....

The most lively restaurant any day of the week in Charlotte! You're guaranteed to have a delicious meal no matter what you order on the menu. I started with a caprese salad, followed by the beet burger, and finished with delicious strawberry shortcake. I thoroughly enjoyed my meal, the service I received, and the atmosphere. Definitely one of the best restaurants in Charlotte!
We had Easter brunch here this afternoon. First time here. I can't say enough good things. Food and service are tops! Will definitely go again soon.

First visit.  Sat solo at the bar for a quick bite.  So this is more of a snapshot than a review.

The Good:
 - Beautiful!  Love the finishes, lighting, ceiling tiles, just great design.  I'm not a concrete bar fan but this one is even pretty cool.  The entrance is especially awesome!
 - Bar Service was warm, genuine, names being traded, good menu knowledge
 - Popcorn offered is nice
 - Had the shrimp and pasta, shrimp were excellent, pasta a little salty for me but a decent meal

The Bad:
 - The only negative was sitting at the bar the TVs are mounted so high you have to crane your neck in order to watch the game
  

Grabbing a quick bite at the bar is not enough to cast an opinion of the overall food scene.  But I have confidence that Jamie is offering some great meals.

My husband and I are visiting my cousin I'm Charlotte and decided to come here before hitting up some of the local breweries. The food was AMAZING! We had popcorn to start and I had the prosecco mojito which was good but sweet. I ended up ordering the shrimp n grits which was divine. There were plenty of shrimp, not too much grits and the sauce and seasoning was great. Would highly recommend.

The only reason I am not giving 5 stars is because after we got our food we literally didn't see our waitress for the rest of the time. We waited for about 30 minutes which was fine because we were talking and the bartender had to go get our check. Service wasn't the best.

Have to say I was pretty disappointed in the experience. Liked the atmosphere but food was a tad marginal. Service was slow, salad was ok and shrimp dish was so-so. Might give it another chance but I doubt it. Also, several sides to choose but nothing green....what's up with that. Again, pretty disappointing and I would not recommend.

After visiting 5Church and absolutely loving their food, I was fortunate enough to experience Nan and Byrons when it first opened up. Just like it's sister restaurant, Nan and Byrons lives up to it's expectation. The inside decor is gorgeous and makes the restaurant warm and inviting. I typically sit on the bar side, while the other side of the restaurant is better for larger groups or couples looking for a more intimate setting while eating lunch/dinner. There are also TV's on the wall of the bar so it's a great setting for sports or big television events. 

When it comes to their food, I'm obsessed with the French Dip during the day and the Beet Burger at night. Both come with a choice of a side and I usually go for peas and carrots or the Mojito fries. I'm also obsessed with the popcorn that's served as an appetizer (in lieu of the traditional bread and butter.) When I'm not drinking my usual vodka water, I opt for the Nightshade Martini or the Farmhouse Lemonade. Both sweeter vodka drinks that accompany my meals nicely. 

The staff is awesome and they all make every customer feel as if they are welcome. I go to this restaurant probably 3x a week and will continue to do so. :)

The burger with the martini fries are so yummy and seasoned well. The service was really well and were very accommodating to the large group of people we had come unexpected.  The menu is a little pricey for what it is but they give you what you pay for I think.

If you want to pay a lot for "just ok food" go here - they have such great ideas but missing favor - I order a bunch of apps - all sounded amazing but had no taste -also thought drinks were suppose to be good - they are but you don't taste the alcohol - I probably would not go back unless someone else really wanted to go 
I had high hopes and even considered a party bc the place looks cool but food Not memorable

We went to Nan & Byron's thinking it was a trendy South End restaurant that was bound to have good food since its owners were 5Church. We were fooled from the minute we walked in the door to see a mostly empty space. Not a good thing in the restaurant business. However, there can be off nights. Our disappointment was compounded by a really crappy wine by the glass list and popcorn with Old Bay Seasoning that really wasn't as enticing as it may sound. My Cobb salad was nothing out of the ordinary and my husband can't remember what he ordered as it was so unremarkable. The staff were great. The restaurant is well done, but the food meh!

We visited here for dinner during restaurant week. We had a great meal and loved the ambience.  We decided to give brunch a try. My husband loved his breakfast burger. I ordered the Huevos Rancheros, which would have been good if it wasn't for the salt!  It was so salty it was inedible. I was extremely disappointed.

Desperately in search of a place to eat on NYE's ...because our evening came to a holt when our plans fell through. 
We were in NoDa at 6:20pm popped up open table and snagged a 6:45pm slot at Nan & Byron's. 
It was said on the phone that this was a birthday dinner, yes the mister has a New Years Day Birthdate.. sucks for him. lol
Anyhow we arrived and we were pleasantly greeted, pretty hostess without the overly fake greeting and smile. :)
Someone shortly came over and addressed the mister by name and presented him with a HAND WRITTEN birthday card that included a 10% off our next visit.
How nice was that?? 
Great touch guys, we were ALL impressed.

The decor is a quirky mix of rustic polished over with modern design with a touch of glam. Loved it. 

Food- we ordered 3 apps, steak and meatloaf amongst our table, 
everyone was pleased with their dishes, we did however send back 2 steaks due to being a little to rare for our taste.
They happily sent them back and came back out as quickly as possible.

The only suggestion I have would be to add some steamed veggies to the Sides menu, although I subbed mine for a salad.

Overall, Nan & Byrons is a great place for comfort food without having to go to a place that smells like a rest home, know what I mean??

I am so pleased at their service on NYE and cant wait to go on a normal evening.
Though this definitely gives us a big push to go to 5 Church asap.

Thanks to the Team at Nan & Byrons.

Management/ owners hold no reservations about screaming at employees in the middle of a busy restaurant. If you find yourself there on a busy night, don't stay too long because they will ask you to get up to make room for "other diners". Everyone who works there looks like they hate their lives and I'm sure their "professional management staff" has a lot to do with that. The food isn't bad, but you should choose to give your money to a company that treats people like actual people.

Not sure what all the hype is about. The atmosphere of the place is very cool and I wanted to really like the food but it didn't happen. Overall I think the menu is nothing original, it is just falling the pattern of "this isn't your mom's recipe" type of thing. 

The service was great and the drink list was good and had interesting options for cocktails. But that's where it ended. 

The roasted chicken was dry and not that much flavor. (Harris Teeter sells better chicken!) The pork shoulder was also extrememly dry and served on a bed of BBQ beans that taste "fresh from the can". Tried the apple cobbler desert and it came out barely room temperature and not cooked fully. Guess it needed more time in the microwave. 

Charlotte has a lot more places that offer similar food but done incredibly better than this. I hate to see restaurants that spend tons of money on atmosphere then go cheap when it comes to the food.

Me and my fiancé ate here the other night, during its first week of business. This place was awesome. We were sat by a large open area, the garage door was pulled up and the whole restaurant was open to the outside. It was cool outside but not freezing so we did not complain. The waitress was friendly and knowledgeable and got our drinks out in a timely fashion. 
The restaurant serves popcorn instead of bread, and it is seasoned with cayenne pepper and Sazon, making it have a nice kick to it. 
I ordered the farmhouse burger, which came with a homemade pickle and homemade poblano cheese, It was easily the best burger I've ever had in Charlotte. My fiancé ordered the steak with corn and mac n cheese. He loved it.  For dessert we ordered the brownie with homemade peanut butter ice cream. It was delicious.
All in all we had a great night, and we will definitely be going back. It's worth a trip to check this place out.
I love this place.  I have been here several times and have always had a great meal with great service.  I would certainly eat here again.
Got the Wagyu Flank and it was AMAZING!  A little noisy but we did have two large parties on either side of us.  Will definately be going back.

Such an amazing space...  I wish, wish WISH it were better, they have a fantastic location and the design is fantastic, I love the details.  This was my third attempt and I am finally writing about it.  I kept trying because I want to like it.  This time, I made a huge mistake opting for the $21 buffet, I really do not know what I was thinking.  Why would I want something that is out in the open, everyone that is seated walks right past the uncovered cheese, dips and sweet treats, ick.  The bacon was undercooked and rubbery, the fried chicken was so dry you could barely get it down, the deviled eggs were warm (I am clearly a health nut) and there wasn't a green to be found other than a cheese filled spinach dip and a teeny salad that was positioned next to the seafood offering.  Needless to say, I will not try it again.

Had dinner here for a friend's bday dinner. Atmosphere was nice. Servers were polite yet not very knowledgable about the menu or drinks. The pimento cheese spread was not what we expected. Very disappointed, however the cheese dip served with homemade potato chips was amazing. A must have!!!

Parking is an absolute nightmare. We thought they had valet and come to find out it's only on certain nights. 

One a side note DO NOT SIT IN THE ROOM OFF TO THE SIDE. There is AC and it is extremely uncomfortable. When asked about it. The sever said its always like that. Very poor circulation.
Just went here for Father's Day.  The food was terrific, and the service was excellent!

Great spot in South End for a week night or weekend dinner. Also a fun bar to sit and enjoy some cocktails at. 

Once you sit, you will get to munch on some spiced popcorn. 

I've had the meatloaf... Twice. It was yummy. 

Services was good and servers were friendly.  

Valet parking (on busy nights).
Very cool atmosphere. I had the meatloaf and it was pretty amazing. Looking forward to going back and trying something else.

I've seen some of the negative reviews on here but my experience was great. They must have gotten their act together. This was my first time so I had nothing to compare it to.

Great service. Megan was really top notch. Knew the menu front to back and had genuine suggestions to steer you. My group got the pork chops (their signature dish), shrimp and grits, and the beet burger. All were very well made. We also tried the home made Oreos which were awesome.

Good vibe in there. Lots of people. All around really fun night.

I used to LOVE this place, went all of the time, solely for the beet burger. The recipe changed! No more thick beet medallions - the burger is now more deep fried breaking than beets. Disappointing! I haven't been blown away by other menu options. Hoping they go back to the old recipe. 

Hubby likes the burgers a lot, as well as local beer options.

This review is solely based on Sunday brunch: Meh. Made reservations and had to wait while they seated someone who showed up late for their reservations even though I was on time. Service was entirely disinterested in working that day and made it quite apparent. Bloody Mary's premixed and lacked flavor. It's kind of hard to screw up a mimosa but it basically tasted like vaguely fizzy Tang. Every time I went to the buffet LITERALLY EVERYTHING was empty or they were taking the ladles away. Wait what??? Why the sshh are you taking away ladles for no darn reason?? Most food once I could get any was just ok. 
Bathrooms clean. Parking limited. Not sure how this place gets on "best brunch in Charlotte" lists...
Fun atmosphere, great food and the service is perfect!  Popcorn to get you started and the chicken soup is nothing like grandma's!

Came for my birthday and it was great, so my sister and I decided to bring my parents for a family dinner. My mom ordered a burger well-done and it came pink the middle and her whole meal was cold. 
I'm gluten-free and ordered tacos with corn tortillas. I told the waitress I was gluten-free while ordering and they still brought flour tortillas. I sent them back and they brought back the same plate - with flour tortillas but they had heated it up. Everyone else was done eating my food came back so I had to eat fast and by myself and they still charged us for the tacos.

We just went for brunch and ordered their eggs benedict and french toast. The french toast was delightful and the only complaint about the eggs benedict was the sausage was more turkey burger than sausage. The kale was a unique touch, but my plate had a bit too much of it. Luckily, it was easy to remove the excess to my liking.

The atmosphere was fine for a Saturday brunch and I really love the fact that they  have only local beers on draft.

Biggest complaint was that our waitress was HORRIBLE. It took her 15 minutes to take our order, and then we never saw her again, except for when she passed over our table every 5 minutes walking to her other two tables. We never had a single refill ofnour drinks, she never checked to see if our  order was correct, never even acknowledged that we were eating there and when I finally flagged her down for my check, all she said was "sorry". (In my opinion, if you are overwhelmed with 3 tables, you should find a new career).

We will go back to this place since the menu looks so good, but I can't see this being one of our regular places.

Worst drinks and food that I've had in Charlotte in years. If you love hot drinks and cold food this is your spot!!! The manager did take care of somethings to try to fix what the kitchen had so badly messed up. You would think when a table went so wrong they may not charge you for mustard but nope they charged us. Waitress was very sweet but needs a bit more training. All in all a waist of an evening.

Definitely try the Farmhouse Lemonade, and the smoked pork spring roll!  Both are delicious!  My husband had the seared tuna and I had the Hanger steak and we both enjoyed them.  For dessert, I had the Chocolate torte, he had the banana pudding, and both were delicious!  Looking forward to returning to try more!

We have been anxiously awaiting the arrival of Nan & Bryon's in Dilworth. We live two blocks away and frequently walk to dine at Lucianos and 300 East. Our first disappointment is being served wine in juice tumblers. For heavens sake, who wants to drink red wine out of juice glass. (On a separate occasion, the GM told a friend of mine if he didn't like the wine glasses, he should order a vodka...I said 'WHAT'?).
Secondly, I am vegetarian, the choices are minimal but ok. I ordered the Portobello entree with two sides. My entree arrived on top of my sides. The flavor of all 3 things was now just ick. While I was away a week ago, my boyfriend revisited with friends and tried a shrimp entree. Still underwhelmed. Now they have rolled out lunch at the same prices as dinner. Personally, I'll give this place 2 more tries but it's unlikely that I'm going to drink wine out of a juice glass. Dilworth has a lot of nice restaurants who are anxious to please.

The menu has changed and some of my favorites have disappeared. They seem to be concentrating on steak which is a bit of a disappointment with Sullivan's so close.  The food was solid and the service good, but not very exciting.

We tried Nan and Byron's tonight for the first time... the service was friendly and efficient.  The food was good...  I stepped away to use the ladies room and that's where the good review ends.  The room is very dark... tissue all over the floor... in the stall that i occupied there was no place to hang or put a handbag except the floor.  Though there is room for more than one sink, there was only one with a very small counter that was soaked.  A line waiting for the sink caused me to be very quick, but the room was too dark to reapply lipstick or comb hair and the counter way to wet to lean over for a closer look.  It never ceases to surprise me that the comfort and cleanliness of the bathroom is overlooked.

This is my favorite restaurant in Charlotte.  The restaurant has a trendy yet comfortable vibe and I always know I'll leave satisfied.

The spiced popcorn (free before the meal arrives) is a great touch.  My favorite entree is the grilled portobello with an amazing onion hollandaise sauce and a sweet potato and blue cheese gratin (its amazing) plus perfectly-cooked brussel sprouts.  We usually don't get dessert at restaurants, but we always get the house-made oreos at Nan & Byron's.

Used to love this place.  Service was slow and waiters were grumpy.  Popcorn came without the usual seasoning.  Food did not come out warm.  Manager just standing around talking.  Sadly disappointed tonight.

Nan & Byron's closed for a private event, but forgot to adequately block tables available for reservation. I received a confirmation email for a brunch reservation to celebrate my fiancé's birthday....when we arrived, we were told they were closed. To top it off, the hostess did not seem to believe I had a confirmation, until I showed her the email. Very disappointed in the lack of professionalism, and the restaurant's ability to adequately close reservations when hosting private events.

Nan's is my new favorite restaurant in Charlotte. I've eaten here several times I have never been disappointed. My friends and I like to go for dinner and drinks and stay and hang out at the bar after. I have also brought friends from out of town here, and will be bringing my parents when they come to visit. The restaurant is warm and inviting, and the energy is always up no matter what time of day it is. Sometimes it takes a minute to get your table (and yes, you need a weekend dinner res), but once you're seated the service is FAST. I have been to nan's several times and I am still noticing new things about the décor. It is clean and modern but has a lot of rich, interesting touches. From the ceiling to the floors, they did a great job...seriously, look up when you're in there :)

So far I've had the kitchen sink salad, added chicken with the siracha ranch. It was awesome...its not exactly a healthy salad (it has chips on it) but it was delicious & different. I've also had the chicken, got the mashed potatoes and corn as my sides. One of my favorite meals. The appetizers are great - peppadew poppers and train wreck fries are my favorites. My friends are still raving about how good the meatloaf is. 

The drinks are very different - they put a unique twist on classic cocktails. I've tried the Jalapeno margarita, sparkling mojito, farmhouse lemonade, g'night moon, and the refashioned. I like all of them - favorite is the refashioned, and my girlfriends are huge fans of the lemonade and mojito. The margarita has a little kick to it but just enough.

On weekend nights the bar scene is pretty good. A lot of locals from the south end come in and the crowd is casual yet classy. Saturday nights there's a DJ and I've seen a few dance parties breakout...its always a good time. 

Overall, I love this place, and I'm excited for the warm weather - looking forward to enjoying drinks and food out on the patio. Glad the south end got such a wonderful new addition!

Full disclosure.  I didn't want to like this place.  All I could think of was..."Gee whiz.  Another American comfort food restaurant. How boring!". Since it's by the folks who run the chic and upscale 5 Church in Uptown, I also (incorrectly) assumed this would be the same "see-and-be-seen" trendy atmosphere, not something suited for the South End, where the vibe is decidedly more eclectic, casual and laid-back. 

But since N&B's opened, I've been at LEAST 10 times (No joke!  It's close to work) and every time the food has been delicious, the service fast and friendly, and just like my friends and coworkers say...reasonably priced and unpretentious. 

First off, yes, there are staples like grilled cheese and tomato soup, prime rib, and spaghetti and meatballs. These are all fine.  But what stands out, and is simply fantastic?  The beet burger (lunch and dinner) and the meatloaf burger (only for lunch). 

Let me wax poetic for a moment about the glory of the beet burger.  This genius burger includes crunchy deep fried slices of beet, goat cheese, avocado, onion, greens, buttery soft bun.  This makes for a very good sensory experience.  Add a side of greens with peach vinaigrette, and it makes for a really satisfying meal for $8.50. 

Did I mention, I don't really like beets? 

The new meatloaf burger is a relatively thin slice of their silky, meaty meatloaf, griddled with Sriracha hot sauce ketchup.  It too is excellent...and not like your traditional meat loafs. 

The atmosphere is casual and comfortable...a complete 180 from the old Vinny's Raw Bar decor.  This means my husband can wear workout gear, while I wear work clothes, and we can dine together and not worry about feeling out of place. 

BONUS: The food comes out fast.  Also, instead of bread, you get a basket of salt and pepper popcorn, which is a nice snack and change of pace to bloat-inducing bread and butter. 

TIP: People who don't want to valet for dinner service, park at the Rite Aid lot and walk about 25 feet over.  Note...the Rite Aid says they'll tow anybody who isn't a customer...but after 10+ meals here, I have yet to witness or experience this myself.

Not impressed. I really had high expectations for this place based on the reviews but I was highly disappointed. There were 4 of us and who ordered different meals. But, there was one thing in common.... Bland bland bland. Don't recommend!

Went here for dinner on a weekday, no wait and was able to enjoy one the last nice days at a table outside. No issue with service.  Instead of bread, they bring out seasoned popcorn. Was not about to start my meal getting popcorn stuck in my teeth...it was a bid odd since we weren't even drinking cocktails.  Ordered the pork belly appetizer; the pork was dry, tough and not very flavorful. Entrees included steak and a chicken dish. The main proteins were cooked well, however the sides were lacking in flavor and did not compliment the dish. We did not elect to try dessert. Overall I would not go back or recommend this place, I was just happy the main proteins were half way decent.
Dinner last night was really good.  The pork chop was awesome.  The bartenders were especially accommodating with a special drink request for me.  We'll be back.

Not good, prime rib was like steak and eggs at IHOP. Mac cheese tasted liked noodles w reduced milk! Someone needs to help this place out, the acoustics are that of a tunnel and you can't hear anything people two seats away are saying!

I have been to Nan and Byron's several times now and love it more each time. The Nightshade Martini is hands down the best martini I've ever tasted. My favorite entree is the 8 oz. Prime Rib with the mac n cheese. The mac n cheese is a MUST TRY. Great service, great environment - definitely recommend this place.

I have been waiting for this place to open for months because it is in my neighborhood, and I finally got to go there tonight.  I went alone and sat at the bar and ordered the spicy margarita (excellent) and then dinner.  It's a dark, chic-looking place clearly in tune with the South End area, but the food is traditional American with a lot of twists.  At the bar they serve everyone popcorn, which has a spicy kick.  I ordered the chilled shrimp with New Orleans spicy remoulade, then had the spaghetti and meatballs.  That's not a common entree on restaurant menus these days, but this version was outstanding, and it had a lot of bite as well.  They seem to make lots of things spicy, even my drink, and I really like that, though it may not be for everyone.  Nonetheless, the review is my opinion reflecting my taste only, and it's 5 stars for me.  I will be back.
Delicious! I'm addicted to the popcorn they bring to the table! Love the atmosphere!

So anyone who has read any of my reviews should know that I am a excellent cook and it is really hard for me to find food in restaurants that really excites me. Of course Nan's is in this category. We went for Fathers day Sunday Brunch and the staff was great. The buffet was the only thing available and the selection was excellent. The taste left much to be desired. The line started with muffins and Danish which were fine but not homemade. Next was a seafood tower with excellent shrimp oysters and crab legs wonderful cocktail sauce( mines better) and two salads. Dressings were nothing special and the Caesar was a little too creamy for my taste. Next was potatoes and eggs. The potatoes were under cooked and eggs over but hey it's a Buffett. Grutss were good bacon and sausage were there and that famous meatloaf was too herbal for me . I need to go back and order from the menu

Great spot for drinks, brunch, lunch, or dinner.  I've been for all four and everything about this place is consistent and convenient.  Love the deviled eggs, beet burger, and mac & cheese!  I think I like it best for happy hour because the crowd is a good collection of all types.  It's definitely a favorite along with 300 East which is harder to get a reservation.  I also like that it's in walking distance to a bunch of new brewery type places.  I'd raise my review to 5 stars if the portions were bigger and if they didn't charge extra for dipping sauces.  I like to dip fries in salad dressing and charging for a tiny bit of dressing is a bit stingy.  But that is minor gripe and I'll be back again and again.

"The service was good."  A death knell from a 17 year old.  Food service-esque fried fish--really?  Great atmosphere, but vastly better options out there.  Needs work.  I wouldn't drive past Mac's, The Liberty, or Lebowski's to get here.

Sunday Brunch Buffet Review:

- Food: decent selection (pastries, biscuits & gravy, bacon, sausage, shrimp & grits, eggs, pancakes, french toast, home fries, mac & cheese, potato chips & pimento cheese, chicken fried rice (?!), crab legs, shrimp, and oysters). but, nothing tasted above average except the biscuits and sriracha ketchup. most of the items were not fresh. oysters were terrible.

- Service: absolutely average, if not slightly awkward. 

- Value: meh. For $21, it wasn't worth it for me. I know, I know, you get a mimosa or bloody included... but the mimosa was super weak and the bloody was tiny, and the food didn't make up for it. Bistro la Bon's brunch buffet is better.

Nan and Byron's has excellent food, a well-trained and friendly staff, and a fun atmosphere.  I went on Tuesday night with friends and ordered the hushpuppies to start, which arrived absolutely delicious--perfectly fried with honey butter on the side.  I ordered the beet burger as my main course, and as a vegetarian who has encountered many "veggie" burgers, this one blew my mind. The burger arrived on a perfect brioche bun, smeared with avocado (my favorite). The beets stole the show, lightly coated in panko breadcrumbs and fried to achieve that perfect crunch when bitten into. I even tried dessert- strawberry shortcake, which was equally amazing!  I'll definitely be back!

Had my first experience tonight. The bartender and waiters were very attentive and seemed very knowledgeable about the menu. I do feel it was a little over priced but had a great variety to choose from. However, toward the middle of my meal I got a bad taste in my mouth. It wasn't the food.I witnessed someone I had not seen earlier talking to the employees as they were trying to accommodate a large party in the "garage room"  I guess that's what you can call it. Apparently, the tables were not done to this persons liking. At first I thought it was a customer not satisfied with the positioning of the tables. I sat there and listened to the way this person was speaking to the employees being very loud and rude. I looked around to see that other tables were listening as well. After I saw this person go to an empty table I realized he worked there. On my way to the restroom I stopped an employee and asked who it was. I was told it was the owner. I was shocked and even more shocked when I walked out of the bathroom and saw him leaning up against an empty bar table( at the front of the restaurant), checking his phone and eating what appeared to be a banana... I never once saw him check on a table. He could have but I never witnessed it in my 2 hours of being there. He certainly never asked us how we were doing. It's hard for me to want to return after seeing the way he treated his employees. This was enough for me to download yelp for the first time and give a review...

We either got the waiter's first night or they need improvement. It wouldn't have been that bad, but the food was over-priced for the quality, which was exacerbated by the service.

I think it has potential, but a little ways to go.

How to start this out? First impressions of this sister restaurant of 5 Church is less than mediocre. From the front when you first walk in you expect a place that's gonna give you great choices of meat, fish, and poultry localized, and taking advantage of the great farm to table scene we have here in Charlotte, but what we came to find out that's it's nothing more than the "college kids craigslist apartment of the culinary world".  Not one thing matches each other. NOTHING! The decor and ambience were very nice, open floor plan, very inviting, beautifully rustic with an urban feel, but only leaves you with the giant question mark or sour taste in you mouth from wanting more. (Looks aren't everything) 

When we first sat down we asked what exactly was the concept of the restaurant, and we were informed that it's "comfort food"? The only comfort I found was ending this Enigma of a night and asking for the bill. 


In regards to the food, poor selection, limited menu, no creativity nor flavor, and overall bland. Only 12 items that suspiciously resemble what I can receive at a place that's on the corner of 5th and church (hint, hint). It's like 4 people came up with an idea of what sells at one place, we'll through it on a menu, and add smashed bland potatoes, or a truck load of crispy onions, re-name the place in a different location and call it a day. We all understand Charlotte is not a culinary Mecca if you will, but this tom foolery is not pulling a fast one on anyone. I mean pop corn to start out at the table? Really? Something that's cheap and adds no complement nor nutritional value to the apparent question mark that's already lingering in the room. You just end up asking yourself why?

The one saving grace of this place, was something so small and minute that I wouldn't even call it saving. POPOVERS! Tasty and savory. About the only thing that actually challenged my palate whatsoever.

Went there for dinner recently.  I found the menu to be limited but ordered the Shrimp Pasta which I thought was just okay.  Had a bite of a friend's fish and chips and thought that the fish was very breaded and mushy. The smoked poblano cheese dip was very good though.  Atmosphere is very noisy.  Probably would choice to go elsewhere for the money.

Pros: popcorn! They give you buttery, perfectly seasoned popcorn before the meal. A different and unique idea than the standard bread. My husband's pork chop was perfectly cooked. Lots of menu options and I like that they have vegetarian options, like the beet burger.

Cons: the two apps we ordered weren't worth the price. The fried oysters were tiny, but tasty, although underseasoned. I didn't feel like we were getting our money worth. I ordered the meat loaf, which was dry, and the mashed potatoes, which were underwhelming and like the meat loaf, also a bit dry.

We may or may not come back.

First time here for a late lunch but what we got was great!! The jalapeño margarita was one of the bests I've had. The tomato soup and crab cheese half sandwich was good.  Ambiance was great.  Staff was very friendly. Service was good!! I would come back when I come back to Charlotte.  I also heard they do an awesome brunch on the weekends with bottomless mimosas! That's always a great touch!!

The dessert left me feeling a little sad, the french fries were delicious (especially when drowning in ranch), and the burger... a burger is something I never forget. I got the Farmhouse Half Pounder with smoked poblano cheese, a house-made bbq sauce, and bacon. This was a Top Ten burger easily and worth every bit of the $13 price tag.

Fun atmosphere but I was disappointed in the Sunday brunch. For $23, I would liked to have seen homemade pastries, lots of fresh berries, something inventive rather than plain scrambled eggs, home fries, hotel standards. etc. Upsides are the pimento cheese, and if you like cold steamed shrimp and crab legs. I'll definitely come back to try the non brunch menu. Tip... Don't expect mimosas before noon. State law. Looks like the place would be more fun in the evening when candles are lit and the glass garage door is thrown open for a more indoor, outdoor setting.

We only have come here for Sunday brunch but they have a great selection of food an did taste great.. I do love that the mimosas are only $2 a piece after the first one which is a great deal. We have been there a few times now and food is good. I am sure we will come back for lunch or dinner another time.

We came here on Friday night for a date night! We made reservations in advance and I am glad we did because it was packed! 

Seating:
-We walked here so I can't comment on parking. We got seated right when we walked in. The place is pretty small so be prepared to be sitting stupid close to another group/couple eating. If you have ever seen the movie Valentines Day, it is like the scene when they are out to dinner. Anyways, not a huge deal but I felt bad getting out after we were done eating cause I almost hit their table!

Drinks:
-I thought the drink selection was pretty pricey. My husband got a craft beer (about $6) and I got some white cran cosmo (about $9). My drink was tasty but I am not sure if there was any alcohol in there! It wasn't strong enough for my tastes. 

Food:
-Ok this is where Nan and Bryon's earns its stars! The food was excellent!!!
-Starters/Appetizers: They give you complimentary popcorn that was awesome! We also ordered the fried oysters, which was the appetizer special for the night. Oh. my. gosh!!! They were so good. I have no clue what was in the sauce but it was this spicy tangy mix. Awesome!
-We decided to split the meatloaf with sauteed corn and mac and cheese as sides. They brought it out split up on two plates, which is so appreciated! The meatloaf was incredible and the siracha ketchup was a perfect combo. It was a little spicy but I just took some off and solved that problem. The corn was delish! I think I could eat like 10 servings of that corn. The mac and cheese was good, not amazing but definitely good. The meatloaf is served on top of the mac and cheese and corn so beware that when you order two sides, they will basically be mixed together. I liked this cause our sides complimented each other!
-Decided to forgo dessert but it sounded good.

Overall, great place and I can't wait to see where it will go in the futre.

Weekend Night Dinner:

No tables available, seemed like a very busy place, private party in a tent, but plenty of room at the bar so decided to eat there with a friend. Atmosphere at this place is really nice.

Drink service was really poor, our bartender struggled with making an irish coffee, had to be sent back twice. Also had to explain how to make an old fashioned to her, which is a fairly simple drink.

Had the cheese and meat sampler for an appetizer, fantastic. The goat cheese is great, as well as the sweet beef.

I had the portobello mushrooms for dinner which were fairly average, the sweet potato casserole was too starchy and salty. My friend had the steak salad had good presentation, but steak was very well done.

Price was average, I believe total bill was $68, server really struggled on how to split a bill, took about 15-20 minutes.

Didn't find anything here that would have me coming back.

First time for the brunch and was impressed given it was their first day serving brunch. 

Omelette was very good with fresh quality ingredients. Portobello mushrooms, fresh kale and tomatoes. Rye toast was very good as well. 

Only complaint would be the extra charges for jelly and hot sauce. That should be provided with the meal. 

I will be back!

The service is absolutely terrible: hostesses didn't greet us, our waiter (or I would say bartender because it sounds that they only have bartenders and bus man) give our table to someone else, explaining that his shift his over (the most unprofessional behavior that I've never seen) and our new waitress was very rude and couldn't figure it out what we ordered so we have to repeat again everything.... In addition she removes our plates without asking us anything... If I give 1 star it's because the food was okay, we get the scallops, mac and cheese and sweet potato but the desserts was absolutely disgusting (cheesecake and apple tart). So please stay away from the restaurant, for the same price you can find a better service and better food aswell. I am not usually a picky person but this restaurant is absolutely a mess, and of course we won't come back.

I had an opportunity to get here a few weeks ago and better-yet twice within that one week. My first visit was centered around the bar as the plan was to check out the atmosphere of what appeared to be the new hot spot restaurant in South End. Having just recently moved from Uptown to a South End I was anxious to see what the fellas from 5 Church had going on. 

Snagging a spot at the corner of the bar offered a great view of a pretty busy restaurant for a weekday. The bar tenders were attentive and friendly even considering a full bar. After 30 minutes or so I I had to take a peak at the menu and decided that contrary to my initial plan of "drinks only" I was going to grab something small. Now, when a restaurant aims for what it appears Nan and Byron's is aiming for I like to give a good test of the menu and order something a bit atypical. That said, by offering a hot dog and mac and cheese a place like this I couldn't pass this opportunity up. It wasn't even on the kid's menu! Let's be honest, if you can nail a hot dog and mac and cheese at what appears to be a quality restaurant than more power to ya. Certainly I agree that with this order I couldn't have possibly expected much, but again, it is Nan and Byron's that offered it and so I had to take them up on it. 

Unfortunately I was pretty disappointed. I can't complain much about the value as these were some of the less expensive items on the menu but I can certainly complain of the quality. Honestly, if you are going to go out on a limb by offering a hot dog at a place like this then I'd expect you would at least reward the customer daring enough to order it. The presentation itself was good but the flavor wasn't much greater than what you'd expect from your most basic hot dog. When I asked the bar tender what we were dealing with she admitted she thinks it is a Nathan's hot dog...boiled! Not grilled, but boiled. Who in their right mind boils a Nathan's frank! As for the mac and cheese I can't really speak much about it; not much to write home about and although creamy couldn't help but think "Velveeta". I'm sure it wasn't and maybe I'm more of a baked mac and cheese guy but this wasn't doing it for me. 

Although I will admit this isn't the end of the world for food delivered to my bar stool but I don't think I would be happy if I placed this order from a table. However, this is the point of the experiment, no? Try something from the menu so atypical that likely very few people would order it in an attempt to test the integrity of the one who decided to place the item on the menu to begin with. It is that mindset that brought me back to Nan and Byron's for "round 2" less than a week later to try something more typically ordered.

On my second visit I decided to go for more or the full experience; grab a table and order something more typical. When my girlfriend and I arrived it was Friday around 9:30pm. Upon entering we were greeted by the hostess who was quick to ask us if we had a reservation. I thought it was strange to ask considering the number of tables available. Since we of course didn't have a reservation the hostess asked us to take a seat to wait for the next available table. Now, I'm not sure if this was a ploy to make them seem busier than they were or possibly an attempt to limit the workload on their staff. Either way it is always frustrating to wait for a table when 1) you are only a party of two and 2) you can see empty tables. At the end of the day it wasn't more than a 15 minute wait so not a huge deal. 

Once we were seated I began to take in the atmosphere itself. The setup of the restaurant is great and the design is appealing. I can see this place being a good go-to for a casual date night. As per my previous experience I can attest to the friendliness of the bartenders and could see a drink or two first at the bar before grabbing a table for dinner being a great date experience. Additionally, who could say anything bad about the decision to serve fresh popcorn in place of the old standby bread? Who doesn't love popcorn?!? By the time the waiter took his second pass we were ready to order and I went with his recommendation which was the meatloaf while my girlfriend went with a standard cheese burger. The meatloaf was okay in that the consistency was good, not dry etc. Serving size was good and the roasted corn was very good thought maybe a bit "too roasted" with some bites. However, although I can understand the difficulty in getting the spices right in a meatloaf it truly had waaaay too much rosemary in it. Unfortunately the overwhelming flavor of the rosemary overpowered any other possible flavors and made for a less than perfect experience. The mashed potatoes had some pretty good flavor but were cold in both my order and my girlfriends.

I can't say I wont be back here but I'm certainly not going to rush back. I think this place is certainly worth a shot and with a few tweaks can easily bring my rating up to a 4-star.

Atmosphere was good; food was inconsistent. I ordered the mussels as an appetizer; they were horrible. The menu said they were PEI mussels, but there is no way. They were small, tiny little things. And they were served with one very small piece of bread in a huge bowl of sauce. Do NOT order these. For entrees, our table ordered the tacos, the filet and the pork chop. Filet was excellent, pork chop average and tacos very good. For dessert, we had a brownie sundae, which was obviously microwaved. The first few bites we so hot I burned my mouth and the last few bites were inedible because the brownie was rock hard. The filet is why I'm giving a second star. I won't be back.

Love this cute place!
I had their beet burger with sweet potato fries and it was sooo good! I don't know which one I liked better, the burger or the fries!! 
We also had the deviled eggs for our appetizer but that was just okay...and the popcorn they serve you for free, I can do with out that too..its just whatever!

But I will definitely be back for the beet burger and sweet potato fries =)

I have been to Nan and Byron's twice.  Once with a large group and one with another couple for dinner.  They definetly did a much better job with our smaller group.  So I would probably not choose somewhere else to dine with a large group for a special occasion.

The atmosphere in there is kind of a farmhouse feel but upscale casual. Parking on a busy night is kind of pain but they do have valet which is nice. I got the meatloaf and really enjoyed it but did not feel like it was anthing extrodinary.  I think that their cocktail selection is what I enjoyed most.  They had a wide variety of cocktails that were fun to try.  I would suggest stopping in here for a drink at the bar for sure.
As a girl who appreciates the delicacies from the coast, I hated the seafood on the brunch buffet. Bloody Mary's were the worst I've had in Charlotte. Meh!
Loved the atmosphere. Sweet hostesses that seated us on time. Food, service and bartenders were all five stars!  Looking forward to going back!

I went with a group of friends for restaurant week. I started with the Caesar, as did one of my friends. It was a pretty typical Caesar salad. Another friend got the Cobb salad, which looked amazing, and she said it was. For the entree part I ordered the chicken with corn & mashed potatoes. The chicken was cooked quite nicely. It was pretty flavorful, but what set it off was the sauce that came with it. The corn was what I would've expected. Mashed potatoes a bit above average, I could've easily eaten more. The deserts were nothing spectacular. 

But on the service side; phenomenal! The server was incredibly knowledgable. He also knew the perfect balance of being attentive, without overbearing. Additionally he also time our meal perfectly.

I really wanted to love Nan and Byron's. It's a hip restaurant that has made a name for itself in the Charlotte dining scene. Unfortunately it has been a let down the two times I've gone. The first time was for dinner and the experience was "okay". I ordered one of their chicken dishes and some other fusion appetizer. There was a long wait to receive our meals and when it arrived the dishes were just merely acceptable--if anything, rather boring. 

This second time I wanted to give the restaurant another try. I was hopeful that it would be as good as what everyone has hyped it up to be. Unfortunately the results of my visit were much worse than the first. From their dinner menu I ordered their Tuna Tartar (raw) and their Braised Lamb (medium rare). These are two risky but common dishes, and if done well, are usually quite wonderful. Unfortunately one (or both) of these dishes gave me food poisoning later on. Nothing severe, but unpleasant to say the least. Not sure what went wrong there, but I can say the lamb was a rubbery mess that was hardly edible and something I really should've sent back to the kitchen.

The service also did not improve the second time around. The wait was even longer for something less than satisfactory. The only redeeming factor of my visit was the Banana Pudding for dessert which was surprisingly good. It's a shame everything else wasn't. I can assure you there won't be a third try.

NOTE TO MANAGER** you need to train your staff to warn customers if the plates are 500 degrees when they put them down in front of them! I have bad blistering after lightly touching the plate to scoot it over and it would have been easy for her to have said "Ladies, these plates are hot so don't touch!" The plates were just waaaay too hot anyway. All 3 of our meals looked like the been sitting under a heat lamp for 10 min. And did we get free anything for that? No, just mustard to put all over it to take the pain away.

On separate note, we came for Queens Feast at 6:30 and you'd think they'd want to get us in and out as things got busier. Basically the service just slowed to a hault by 7 and we waited forever to get our meals and drinks. We even had to take our desert to go. And the deserts were pitiful. Key lime pie was supposed to have berries - but none. Smores cheesecake had a lightly browned marshmallow on top of regular cheesecake - pitiful. Although shrimp and grits was good, none of us will be back.

Wow. What a disaster. 

We were sat by the service station. A broom handle loomed over my head. The place was not even a fifth full. It was brunch and we chose the buffet.

At the buffet, every single plate was wet. Not slightly damp, but covered in water. The plates are right next to the host station, I guess that everyone stationed there chose not to notice us wiping our plates dry.

The pastries were cut into smaller pieces (quartered, etc) and dry. The potatoes had so much salt on them, it burned my tongue. And the oysters on the half shell!!! Whoa. They had "melted"- flattened out and filled the shell and now had a firm texture. In a word- disgusting.

I covered my mostly untouched food with a napkin, the waitress asked if I wanted another plate for the buffet. Uh, no.

Never again.

OMG. I hate this place.  Okay, it's a love/hate relationship mainly due to too many good choices on the menu.  Beginning with the appetizers, soups and salads, I wanted to try so many things.  So, we split the Peppedew Poppers (try saying that 3 times fast without laughing) as they were highly recommended, and I ditto that recommendation as they are flavorful, but not too spicy (in-between a bell pepper and a jalapeño).  They have 3 soups to try, and we tried the chicken tortilla which was very chunky with lots of corn and good amounts of chicken.  It was more of a thicker brown mole base broth, but still flavorful.  I like that they have two salad sizes (small and large) for reasonable cost and allows you to have somewhat healthy start to the meal in a starter size.  We tried the side/small cobb salad and it was just the right size and full of good ingredients.

After all of those starters, we had to tell them to not to refill the complimentary spicy popcorn which they keep refilling at the table (yes it is good), we moved on to entrees.  Friend got the fish and chips which was done properly in the traditional sense, but not too greasy and she was happy.  I had the roasted chicken mainly because I wanted to try two of the sides offered.  The chicken was flavorful like a jerk flavoring and they give you a nice breast/wing + leg/thigh that are quite tasty.  I went with the brussels sprouts recommend side and peas/carrots, and they balanced well with the meal (both good).  Needless to say, a great meal, and we had to each take To Go containers home.  Friendly and knowledgeable staff were very attentive.  I am looking forward to my next visit.

Try the beet burger...delicious...it's all beet with no fillers, topped with boursin cheese, a little arugula, and some avocado.  I would definitely order it again.  We sat at the bar, service was quick and the bartender was friendly and helpful as it was our first time there. Parking was difficult but worth the extra effort it took to find a spot.

My sweaty yoga girls and I came for brunch again on Sunday 17 Jan... we had a VERY good experience, service-wise, and thoroughly enjoyed the brunch buffet!  Thank you to our sweet server, and the gracious hostess who took care of us!

Went back to this restaurant for the first time since opening week and was extremely disappointed. The service was slow and unpleasant. The food was average at best. The manager on duty kept hovering over the bartender with an attitude. I talked this place up and to boot my friend felt ill the rest of the night after eating here. I will not go back again.

We sat outside for brunch. The staff was nice but the wait for food on Sunday's is forever! The kitchen gets backed up because of the buffet and a la carte. If you're looking for immediate food go with the brunch. 

I had the salmon Benedict (pretty small). The French toast is really good though but super sweet! 

I'd say the wait is why it loses a few stars and the Benedict wasn't super amazing.

Disappointments across the board. The one thing this place has going for it is the ambiance. Server was super friendly and offered good conversation. Unfortunately our meal was a disaster. . .chicken tacos were overloaded with Jicama, which competed with the dry Jamaican jerk styled breast. The braised pork tacos were even worse with a dried shredded pork rind presence; it left your mind with the unpleasant experience of trying to imagine how good it should have been. The oysters (which are amazing at rooster's and 204 North!) had too much competition on the plate with heavy slices of pineapple and seed laden jalapeño slices to compete with. Amazingly, the smoked chicken wings were drenched in so much rub they too created competing flavors. Overall, it was a major disappointment, but the combos should have rocked... maybe a new inexperienced chef??? We'll never know, we shared our poor food production with the friendly waitress and only received our full bill with no greeting from the manager. Won't be recommending, but on a high note the local craft beer was high class 10/10 and the server was nice.

Was here once prior and had a nice time. Returned for their 2 year anniversary night with the select $2 menu and was extremely disappointed. 

Had a reservation for two people and did not get seated until 30 minutes after. Okay, I get it, you may have taken too many reservations to sit, but 30 mins is pushing it for a two top.

Got sat and were greeted 15 minutes later. Ordered drinks and food at the same time. Received our drinks about ten mins later by another server. Look, the restaurant was busy, but this was now over 45 mins to get a drink after our reservation time.

Saw our server 45 minutes later to be asked if we wanted dessert (not having received our meal yet). He realized how long the wait was for our food and said he was checking on it. 25 minutes later he still hasn't returned with an update. 

We left cash for our drinks and left without receiving our food. I understand food takes a while when the place is packed, but at least give us an update after apologizing for the delay and "checking on the food." Both of us were servers and would have been understanding.

Anyway, we won't be returning unfortunately.

Our group of four had a reservation for a late dinner here on a Saturday evening.  We chose to eat inside, although there is an outside dining area.  At first, I thought it would be more crowded, but we were seated immediately.  The server got our drink orders quickly.  I had the four taco platter and could only finish one of them.  The other people in our group were happy with their meals which included: deluxe burger and side of Mac and Cheese; special taco platter with shrimp; and a shrimp, sausage and grits mix.  
The service was very good, but I thought the prices were a little high, but they may be comparable to the area.

Great brunch on sundays..the menu us fresh and I like the way it is setup. Tables are outside when the weather is nice. Service for drinks were fast both times I visited them. Average price if you need to compare them with other brunch places. I will comeback

Pop corn- They bring this in place of bread.  The seasoning that comes on it was a hot spicy OMG hot not expecting that.  I ended up getting plain and sprinkled salt on it, then it was good! 

Tinny drinks - gin a tonic & vodka tonic
  * came week and tinny

Salmon- my friend said good, but really nothing special.

Yukon gold mashed potatoes - needed serious doctoring. Wouldn't get again!

Mac n cheese - came with breading (not a fan of crusties on my pasta) the pasta was very soft, but the taste was decent

After having a handful of very good meals here, today I got extra lucky when I scored Kevan as my server. He is a self-professed food and drink connoisseur who nailed every recommendation with amazing accuracy. We had the nightshade martini to start (pomegranate juice with muddled cucumber and mint leaves to add some unexpected fresh flavor twists) followed by the kitchen sink salad and then the beet burger. Admittedly, I have seen that beet burger many times on the menu before, but immediately discarded it as a possible choice. It took server Kevan's encouragement to give it a try -  and boy am I glad I did as it is absolutely my favorite burger on the planet at the moment!

I have ordered delivery with Foodie call multiple times.  Normally the food is very good, however there have been 2 times that the sauces have been way to salty.  I ordered the chicken pot pie this week and the chicken was salty and the brown sauce was way too salty.  My guess is they are salting the chicken, then using stock with salt already in it, and then adding salt and reducing it down and not tasting their sauce.  Really need to fix this!!  Everything else with the chicken pot pie was really good and liked the flaky biscuit/pastry served with it.  I also got the cheese plate and I really liked everything on here :)

This is my new favorite restaurant...ever. It was so good that I can't wait to go back to Charlotte again. Really stellar beer selection and the burrata was out of this world good. I can't say enough good things about this place!!!!

Joined some friends, waited at the table for fifteen minutes with no server coming over, so I decided to go to the bar to grab a drink. I waited about five minutes there before being acknowledged. Some really poor service.

We went here for the first time on 9/8/15 
I will never go back!!! The service was very unprofessional. We ask for dirty martinis and they tasted like dirty soap water.

Jamie, if you want your business to continue, you should teach your staff how to be professional and courteous to the customers that are walking through your door.

And just a side-note, I was born and raised in the Dilworth area so I know the changes that have and are happening and this place will not survive. I don't care how many restaurants you own.

As a realtor I would not recommend this place to anyone!

I wanted to wait and give Nan & Byron's a fair shake and go a number of times, especially since I love their sister restaurant 5 Church. It has a very different vibe than 5 Church- a more casual, yet still hopping atmosphere with rustic interior touches. I've been here for cocktails, dinner and three times for lunch. It's totally appropriate for SouthEnd.

I highly endorse it for a place to meet friends for cocktails. Their cocktail/bar menu is inventive and delicious. The bartenders are pretty speedy and friendly. 

As Chad mentioned, the popcorn they give you is a nice way to give your mouth something to crunch on that I believe is nonfat (it's not oily, salty or buttery). It's a good thing because food comes out really really slowly and often not coordinated. In my experience if you have a table of 2, the meals come out at the same time. But if you have more than 2, it's your guess at what order/timing everything will come out. I don't mind that at a tapas place where you're sharing plates with friends, but in a business context where you have  a sandwich and someone else has another sandwich or salad and you're not sharing, it's polite to wait until everyone has their meal.  The other complaint I have about the timing is that the three times I've been for lunch have extended to a 2-hour lunch unnecessarily. Apparently you should announce a the beginning of the meal to your server that you need to get back to work. After about an hour and a half, the last time my coworkers and I had lunch, we asked for the check (even though we weren't done) because we had to get back to work and the server seemed genuinely surprised. Huh? It's a weekday, why wouldn't we have to go back to work??? It was bizarre. Anyway my point is, it's totally fine for a catch up lunch with a friend on a weekend, but beware of a long lunch if you're a working stiff. 

To the food... the peppadew poppers are really interesting and if you're willing to throw caution of calories to the wind, I highly endorse them.  The meatloaf is very grilled - I like the taste of it but the hubs did not. I appreciated the sriracha ketchup.  I do not really like the chicken- it runs very dry and the green beans I've had twice and both times they were over cooked.  If I were to go back for dinner I'd like to try the mushroom with quinoa or Tofu since their vegetarian entrees seem to be more interesting than their carnivorous ones.   For lunch, I definitely like the beet burger with boursin - it's my favorite thing on the menu. They brag about the farmhouse burger but there was something about it I didn't like. It was either the BBQ sauce or the poblano cheese, but the consistency and taste wasn't so good. Based on the wait my burger was "dying in the window" for a while and the cheese coagulated leaving a grainy, weird consistency. So my tip is definitely get the beet burger- you can't get that anywhere else, build your own burger. My friends really like the South End chicken hoagie too.  Though one time two of them got it and they came out at 2 different times and had different things on it. 

For dessert, the shortcake is very heavy. We were able to take 2 bites of it and the rest went uneaten. The PB&J was very interesting and different so my favorite of the two. Next time I'd try the brownie sundae with chili sauce. 

Bottom line- 2.5 stars - this is a place for cocktails or a place to go if you need something greasy, but just make sure you're not in a hurry or expect fantastic service.

The drink menu and bartender service is outstanding. I come here for happy hour with friends because it's so much quieter than other places in South End. However, the food is really underwhelming. I haven't eaten anything there that I felt I couldn't make at home.

I went to Nan and Byron's on their soft opening night and was super excited to dive into the menu as soon as we arrived. We valeted our car (which was complimentary that evening) because apparently there typically isn't enough parking in that lot. 

We were seated immediately upon arriving and our server was energetic and helpful, although she did seem a bit nervous but, hey, it was their first weekend being open! 

We ordered several things from the menu and a couple items stuck out: the siracha meatloaf and cheesecake. The pricing seemed to be fair considering the menu items were more of a casual fare than sister restaurant 5Church. The atmosphere of the restaurant is a bit similar to 5Church in the way that it's hip, classy and comfortable. I actually did notice a few TVs throughout the restaurant as well, which would be nice while eating dinner here on game days. 

My only complaint was the Pimento Cheese appetizer was WAY too heavy. My boyfriend and I couldn't even finish the plate. I'm sure that's an easy kink to work out, though. 

All in all, I would definitely go back to Nan and Byrons to try their other menu items, especially on a warmer day when the garage door in the dining room can be open! This pace will definitely be rocking during the Spring/Summer because of it's fun atmosphere & open-air dining room.

OK Nan and Byron...this was my last trip.  Given that your blocks from my home, I have given you more chances than you deserve.  After multiple meals from dinner to brunch, you have left me with no choice....from the marginal service, to the limited menu and poorly served meals, less than fresh seafood, to not being able to keep the food for the brunch buffet warm or available I'm calling it quits.  To future diners, you have been warned so don't let the trendy setting or good cocktails lure you to a bad experience.  We have better options in the area.

So I finally made it here and left a little underwhelmed. 

I was not impressed with the parking situation. Seriously, even on a Tuesday night when you would think there would be plenty of open spaces....there just were not any. So you can valet or hope you don't get towed in the Rite Aid parking lot. Good luck with that! 

For me the menu was pretty limited. Now, I'm not saying they need 17 pages of choices but I would have liked something outside of chicken, fish and meatloaf. The side option selection was much better. 

I went with a burger, a side of mac and cheese and a cold glass of Triple C's Smoked Amber. Everything was just fine. Nothing really knocked my socks off and converted me into a fan but for what it was....A-Ok. 

What bothered me the most was that this place is SO loud. I couldn't hear anything. I seriously spent most of the night repeating things to my waitress and dining party which eventually turned into me yelling just to avoid repeating...No, thank you...I'll pass. 

I've been, checked it off my list but I won't be running back anytime soon.

Started out at the bar and the atmosphere is great. The service at the bar could be better,  it wasn't busy and it still took along time to get a drink. The waitress was very friendly and helpful. The food was good and plated beautifully. We will be back for dinner in the future.

I've been to Nan and Byron's for lunch twice now and have thoroughly enjoyed each visit. My favorite part of Nan's is the décor. I would describe it as modern farmhouse chic as they incorporate natural wood, cowhide rugs, metal chairs, and rustic embellished walls. The back dining room has a garage-style door that opens up to a patio. Really love everything about venue.
 
The food features a twist on traditional southern comfort food with dishes like meatloaf, farmhouse burger, mac n' cheese, deviled eggs, shepherd's pie, and more. Nan's offered a brunch buffet every Sunday for $21 with a la carte options as well.

I've had the Southend chicken hoagie ($10) and crispy beet burger ($8.5), both off the lunch menu. The hoagie featured marinated chicken breast, sautéed peppers and onions, lettuce, tomato, American cheese, and spicy green sauce. It was a disastrous mess to try and eat gracefully but was a delicious combination of flavors. Note: I substituted the American cheese with poblano cheese...Yum!

 The crispy beet burger was my favorite of the two and came served with boursin cheese, arugula, red onions and avocado. The crunch of the beet paired perfectly with the creamier textures of boursin cheese and avocado. Can't say I've ever had anything like this sandwich and it was delicious (plus light enough to return to work without napping!)

I also had a bite of the Farmhouse burger and was impressed with flavor and texture of the patty but was looking for a little more of the barbeque sauce that was supposed to be on the sandwich.

Both times service was helpful and attentive, especially after we noticed a pricing error on one of our ordered items. Would definitely return to Nan and Byron's and am hoping to sample brunch and dinner menu items soon.

I think this place is a 3.5 across the board. I've been here a few times for dinner, and once for cocktails at the bar. The inside is so quaint and homey. The bar is so inviting and just calls out to you - I've enjoyed many a cocktails there. I remember having the Nighshade martini, which I liked. The cucumber and mint helped tone down the strong, tart pomegranate flavor. My husband and I recently came in for dinner for the 3rd time. We started with the mussels. I'm a huge mussels lover so whenever I see them, I pretty much always order them. These were decent, but something about them seemed off this time compared to previous. Ours were lacking the garlic flavor and the bread was a little mushy. While I was so tempted to try the beet burger (still on the bucket list!), I had the signature tacos for my meal. I really like how they have so many different options to choose from - I got the jerk chicken, beer braised pork, ground beef and crispy shrimp. The pork was my favorite - not much taste to the jerk chicken, and surprisingly, there wasn't much meat! The meat to taco ratio was really poor, in my opinion. My husband had the meatloaf and he liked it. The service was relatively slow, though. unfortunately, no great pictures since we sat outside (they have a neat patio!). I still want to go for brunch. It's a shame this place isn't reviewed higher - they have a great spot and beautiful decor inside. I still think there is much potential to be had!

I really like Nan & Byron's. I love the experience of eating there, I think must be the atmosphere. It is so nice yet so cozy inside! It feels really intimate even though it's not very quiet and usually pretty packed.

The food is always very good. On Wednesday night we ordered the cheese and meat board. It was delicious. There is half price wine on Wednesday nights so it worked out perfectly. My boyfriend got the burger, which he loves there, and I got the Burrata salad with Salmon for the first time. It was my favorite thing I have ever ordered there and one of my favorite salads ever. SO good.

While the service can be very hit or miss here, my experience on Wednesday night was great. Our server was attentive, knowledgeable, and never pushy. I do wish their service was more consistent. 

One last tip- is you like sweet drinks, order their signature strawberry lemonade vodka drink! So refreshing and not overly sugary.

I haven't written a bad review in a long time, but Nan and Bryon's is just asking for it. 

I'm with a group of friends and decided on Nan and Bryon's after a stop at the new dog bar (Lucky Dog). We called and there was no wait on a Saturday night, which was the prime selling point (perhaps a red flag as well). 

They sat us quickly and I settled on the shrimp and grits. The waitress completely sold us on it and sadly, a complete let down. The portion is tiny and the grits were hard and absolutely terrible. I finished the shrimp and andouille sausages because I was starving. Afterwards, I'm still starving! I was concerned about the portion size and even asked the waitress. She said she would be able to provide a side if we need it, which is great. Unfortunately, she never asked and never came back! The bf got the "chicken pot pie," also flavorless and not at all special. On top of that, both of our meals were over $20. I much rather go to Cluck N Cup down the street for my chicken pot pie ($7!) and basically anywhere else for shrimp and grits. 

The last time I was here I ordered a medium rare steak. Instead, I got well done. I sent it back and they came back with rare. I kept it because again, starving. I think I've given nan and Bryon's enough chances. Sorry, not sorry.

What an utter disappointment. The dinner was mediocre, but the service... the service was truly the worst I've experienced in years. There were only a few other tables in the restaurant, but our server disappeared for long stretches of time, and when we finally could get our check, there were so many errors and upcharges. I had to request that she remove an entree we hadn't ordered, and she added various upcharges that weren't accurate. I'd heard good things about the restaurant and had high hopes, but I wouldn't visit here again.

OK, let me first--- spill the beans, I heart the chefs at 5Church and Nan and Byron's, I can't help it- they are both dreamy and sarcastic, so therefore I can't resist their charm or their poblano cheese dip French fries, so sue me.

I have been multiple times, brunch, lunch and dinner, the other day I ordered a cup of coffee.  I couldn't believe how good their coffee was, that alone gets the fifth star from me.
